work.name: HedgeServ
work.summary: HedgeServ is an independent fund administrator that provides various fund accounting services and SaaS tools for portfolio management.
highlights: Hired and managed a distributed international team of nine direct reports (six developers and three QAs)
Worked with project managers to turn client requests and business requirements into development tasks
Successfully designed and managed the development of an authentication system that handles user session and machine-to-machine authentication for all company web services
Lead the development of the first documented public API to enable clients to extract data and build their own tools against HedgeServ data
Began the transition from on-premises Linux servers to AWS cloud-native services
Assisted in managing a distributed team of contractors building a configurable dashboard with Angular and Java
Implemented Docker-based stacks that allow development of web projects without running all dependencies locally
Built and maintained Docker-based CI/CD Jenkins pipelines to build and deploy services
Developed and maintained backend applications and microservices written in Python, JavaScript, TypeScript, and Java
Broke down a legacy Node.js/Ember.js monolith into smaller, focused applications

work.name: V.A.G. Fuel, Inc.
work.summary: V.A.G. manages fuel purchasing for trucking companies. They receive daily bids from multiple suppliers and place fuel orders for customers.
highlights: Designed and built a Django application for receiving and processing fuel bids from multiple third-party suppliers
Built a REST API for suppliers to submit quotes
Wrote a Python application to scrape fuel bids from emails and attachments and upload them to the Django application

work.name: Gannett Fleming

highlights: Designed and programmed control systems for water treatment plants using industrial PLCs
Wrote project specifications that were sent to contractors for bid
